page.title: All your base are belong to us

rev.comment: Undo revision 96799034 by [[Special:Contributions/24.215.207.158|24.215.207.158]] ([[User talk:24.215.207.158|talk]])... apparantly this user cannot count, as the syllables don't add up as stated
rev.diff:
Line 69: Line 69:
==Related phrases and usage==
==Related phrases and usage==
â
The final phrase "for great justice" has been adopted by various groups as their slogan. There is some adoption of "move 'zig'" (which resembles "[[let's roll]]" â a universal command to action; "Zig" was the name of the small fighter craft piloted by the player in ''Zero Wing'') and "Somebody set up us the bomb" or its derivative, "Someone set up us the bomb" (basically "uh-oh!" or "We're under fire!"). Additionally, the remix of the original cut scene, done to a [[techno]] montage includes a famous haiku: All your base your base, base base, All your base your base, are belong to us. This is a [[haiku]] because it contains 5 syllables, 7 syllables, then 5 syllables.
+
The final phrase "for great justice" has been adopted by various groups as their slogan. There is some adoption of "move 'zig'" (which resembles "[[let's roll]]" â a universal command to action; "Zig" was the name of the small fighter craft piloted by the player in ''Zero Wing'') and "Somebody set up us the bomb" or its derivative, "Someone set up us the bomb" (basically "uh-oh!" or "We're under fire!").
There is extensive usage of AYB quotations and references in [[video games]] on the [[List_of_cultural_references_to_%22All_your_base_are_belong_to_us%22|List of cultural references to "All your base are belong to us"]].
There is extensive usage of AYB quotations and references in [[video games]] on the [[List_of_cultural_references_to_%22All_your_base_are_belong_to_us%22|List of cultural references to "All your base are belong to us"]].
